description: From late Middle English seldom, alteration of earlier selden, from Old English seldan (“seldom”), from Proto-Germanic *seldanē. Cognate with Saterland Frisian säilden (“seldom”), West Frisian selden, komselden (“rare, seldom”), Dutch zelden, German selten, Danish sjælden, Norwegian sjelden, Swedish sällan, Faroese sjáldan, Icelandic sjaldan. More at seld and selly.

adjectives.description: seldom (comparative more seldom or seldomer, superlative most seldom or seldomest)

examples: Synonyms: geason, uncommon; see also Thesaurus:rare

adverbs.description: seldom (comparative more seldom or seldomer, superlative most seldom or seldomest)

examples: Synonyms: barely, hardly, rarely, scarcely, infrequently, seldomly; see also Thesaurus:rarely
Antonyms: often, frequently; see also Thesaurus:often
